sentence.idiomatic: I am willing to guarantee that he did this proposal himself.
If you want to get a loan from the bank, you should find someone to be your guarantor.
When applying for a study abroad visa, do you need to have a guarantor?
I was 10,000 RMB overdrawn on my credit card last month.
The team overdid it, playing that many games in a row.
Working overtime for a long time, not eating regular meals like this--it is really taxing on your health.
When I was just starting out in business I was also cheated by people quite a few times.
That swindler is so brilliant, he even fooled this expert.
He thought I didn't understand, and just pulled some data out of the air to try and fool me.
You can't gain experience in a matter of days, you must accumulate it over a long period of time.
He's done business for so many years, he must have accumulated quite a bit of wealth.
Although you don't buy much when you're shopping, you go so frequently that you've accumulated quite a bit of stuff.
Your mother and father do such things because they are thinking of your future.
Consider your safety. Don't drink and drive.
Don't always think about other people, you also need to take care of yourself.
With you by my side, my heart feels a lot more secure.
He is quite a reliable and dependable man. He makes people feel secure.
No matter how late it is my mom will wait up for me; it's the only way for her to get a good night's sleep.
He is just too sleepy. He didn't even realize he fell asleep in class.
Time goes by so fast. We're about to graduate and didn't even realize it.
Going for a walk last night, I again unconsciously walked to her place. It seems that I just can't forget her.
It's not like you didn't know the service was terrible here, what's there to make such a fuss about?
They frequently fight, it's not a big deal.
It's a small thing, everyone doesn't need to make a big fuss over it.
Dear, how about we apply for a credit card?
Didn't we already agree not to get one? Our household income and expenses are all quite stable. We have no use for it.
How can you say that? Nowadays when you stay in a hotel, you have to use a credit card to guarantee the room. Besides, we won't go crazy with it. What's the big deal with just applying for one?
That's what you say now. Once you have the card, you will definitely rack it up, buying all those electronics that you like.

word.literal: a few thousandths of a percent

sentence.idiomatic: Do you really think I have no kind of self-control? Plus, even if we did owe money, the interest is very low. It's only a few thousandths of a percent. What does that amount to?

Stop trying to fool me. I've looked online before--that is daily interest. It accumulates without you even realizing it, then you suddenly owe the bank a huge whack of money, and become a slave to the card. Then what will you do?

You make it sound like it's like a loanshark. Aren't I just thinking of the two of us? You are always saying you would like to go traveling in Europe. If we get a credit card, we can go this year. Generally banks give you more than twenty days to pay back the money without charging you interest.

These twenty-something days you are able to change into tens of thousands of dollars to pay back the bank? Let's just spend what we make, and what extra we have we can put in savings. I don't feel comfortable with over-extending ourselves.

Yikes, nowadays with inflation being so crazy, money just depreciates in value every day. Putting money into savings is a complete waste. You can accept taking out a mortgage to buy a house, why are you so opposed to getting a credit card?
It's precisely because we have to pay off our mortgage that we need to be extra careful about spending money. Anyway, I don't consent to getting a card.
OK then, I will go and get one myself. You have to make such a big deal out of nothing. It's so tedious!
Fine, you go and get one. Later when problems arise it's your responsibility.
